intro: Pleurospermum hookeri var. thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's pleurospermum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with erect, branched stems and hairy leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
